subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: The grep example shows how to search a schema for tables and columns matching a regular expression.

ol.li: Make sure that the Java executable is on your path.
Copy the schemacrawler.config.properties file into the grep example directory.
Start the database server by running StartDatabaseServer script from the distribution directory.
Start a command shell in the grep example directory.
Run grep.cmd (or grep.sh on Unix) to see command line options.
Run grep.cmd -c hsqldb -tables=C.* (or grep.sh -c hsqldb -tables=C.* on Unix) to search for all tables with names starting with 'C'.

Try modifying the command line to search for tables with column names matching a regular expression. Please note that you may need to escape the command line in an operating system dependent way. For example, on Windows, you may need to use grep.cmd -c hsqldb "-tables=C.*|P.*" , with double-quotes around the -tables command-line switch.
Redirect the output of SchemaCrawler into a file, by running grep.cmd > file.txt .
